ar.com.hjg.pngj

Class IdatSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • ar.com.hjg.pngj.DeflatedChunksSet
      • ar.com.hjg.pngj.IdatSet

  • public class IdatSet
extends DeflatedChunksSet
    This object process the concatenation of IDAT chunks.

    It extends DeflatedChunksSet, adding the intelligence to unfilter rows, and to understand row lenghts in terms of ImageInfo and (eventually) Deinterlacer

    • Constructor Detail

      • IdatSet

        public IdatSet(String id,
       ImageInfo iminfo,
       Deinterlacer deinterlacer)
        Parameters:
        id - Chunk id (first chunk), should be shared by all concatenated chunks
        iminfo - Image info
        deinterlacer - Not null if interlaced

      • IdatSet

        public IdatSet(String id,
       ImageInfo iminfo,
       Deinterlacer deinterlacer,
       Inflater inf,
       byte[] buffer)
        Special constructor with preallocated buffer.

        Same as IdatSet(String, ImageInfo, Deinterlacer), but you can pass a Inflater (will be reset internally), and a buffer (will be used only if size is enough)

    • Method Detail

      • unfilterRow

        public void unfilterRow()
        Applies PNG un-filter to inflated raw line. Result in getUnfilteredRow() DeflatedChunksSet.getRowLen()

      • unfilterRow

        protected void unfilterRow(int nbytes)

      • preProcessRow

        protected void preProcessRow()
        does the unfiltering of the inflated row, and updates row info
        Overrides:
        preProcessRow in class DeflatedChunksSet

      • processRowCallback

        protected int processRowCallback()
        Method for async/callback mode .

        In callback mode will be called as soon as each row is retrieved (inflated and unfiltered), after preProcessRow()

        This is a dummy implementation (this normally should be overriden) that does nothing more than compute the length of next row.

        The return value is essential

        Overrides:
        processRowCallback in class DeflatedChunksSet
        Returns:
        Length of next row, in bytes (including filter byte), non-positive if done

      • processDoneCallback

        protected void processDoneCallback()
        Description copied from class: DeflatedChunksSet
        Callback, to be implemented in callbackMode

        This will be called once to notify state done

        Overrides:
        processDoneCallback in class DeflatedChunksSet

      • advanceToNextRow

        public int advanceToNextRow()
        Signals that we are done with the previous row, begin reading the next one.

        In polled mode, calls setNextRowLen()

        Warning: after calling this, the unfilterRow is invalid!

        Returns:
        Returns nextRowLen

      • isRowReady

        public boolean isRowReady()
        Description copied from class: DeflatedChunksSet
        In this state, the object is waiting the caller to retrieve inflated data

        Effective length: see DeflatedChunksSet.getRowFilled()

        Overrides:
        isRowReady in class DeflatedChunksSet

      • getUnfilteredRow

        public byte[] getUnfilteredRow()
        Unfiltered row.

        This should be called only if isRowReady() returns true.

        To get real length, use DeflatedChunksSet.getRowLen()

        Returns:
        Unfiltered row, includes filter byte

      • getDeinterlacer

        public Deinterlacer getDeinterlacer()

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from class: DeflatedChunksSet
        This should be called when discarding this object, or for aborting. Secure, idempotent Don't use this just to notify this object that it has no more work to do, see DeflatedChunksSet.done()
        Overrides:
        close in class DeflatedChunksSet

      • getFilterUseStat

        public int[] getFilterUseStat()
        Only for debug/stats
        Returns:
        Array of 5 integers (sum equal numbers of rows) counting each filter use
